title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: I was asked what my skills are and why I would like to work for them. We also had a little bit of a general conversation so that they could get to know me better
Interview Questions: What is your experience as a writer?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Great it wasn’t lengthy because it was work study. So I applied and got accepted right away. After I applied I got an email that I got it and then just met with the guy that I will be working with.
Interview Questions: No questions it was just a conversation

title: Resident Assistant (RA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: You had to sign up for an interview on one of the two given days, and each day had a time frame. You go the day you signed up for and for the given time frame. You wait in the waiting room and then an RA will come get you and make your way to the designated interview room, where you will be interviewed by an RA and a staff member.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were involved with a community

title: Teacher´s Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Jersey City, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: It was quite good with lot of questions and some online tasks related to my field. It was quite good with lot of questions and some online tasks related to my field.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about this job?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions:
It very easy and clean process for the over all interview. 
Smooth & very easy process i
in-person interview with the team of tow or three people
and discuss the Job description
Interview Questions: Behavioral and Technical  oriented all the question from the JD

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Simple, talk with the professor with the topic of interest, discussing the topic and experience about it.  Contacted the professor via email after reading about the topic of research online and got a call to discuss further.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have regarding this topic

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by 4 people in a Zoom meeting. The interview took about thirty minutes.  Each person asked at least one question in turns. The process was easy to follow.
Interview Questions: Describe my experience with data analysis.

title: Office Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted pretty quickly after applying, and scheduled an interview with the same week. Simple and professional interview  overall or was remote and we used google meet. When I didn’t receive offer, was sent an email which was nice ! So many places just ghost you !
Interview Questions: I do not recall exactly

title: Phoneathon Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: *During COVID* It was a quick Google Hangout call to let the Manager get to know you and they will ask you situational questions to see how you will react and how well you are at speaking.
Interview Questions: How would you react if a prospect's number goes straight to voicemail?

title: Software Engineer - Java Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Harrison, NJ) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
First round was Technical with 3 coding questions.
The second was the Behavioural and 3rd Final round.
- - - -- -- - - - - - - - - - - -
Interview Questions: Tell me About Yourself ?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Applied and got a call about a week later asking for me to come in for an interview. The person who set up the interview was very accommodating of my schedule and I interviewed in-person about a week later.

Overall, the interview went on for about an hour and a half and was very conversational. I was interviewed by two individuals who described the position/culture in great detail. It was a good and easy interview overall but I had a feeling I wouldn't be offered the position even though I received lots of compliments and was told my cover letter was great and that I was clearly well-prepared for the interview. I think they ultimately decided to go with someone who had previous university experience and who wasn't necessarily looking for growth/advancement long-term. At least they made it seem that way in the interview.

Overall, the interview was a very enjoyable experience, but I'm not too disappointed that I wasn't offered the position. Although they seemed like nice people, I could tell that I wouldn't have been happy there. Got a call from the lady who interviewed me about a week later saying that they really enjoyed the interview but had gone with someone else and encouraged me to apply for more opportunities at NJIT in the future
Interview Questions: Tell us about what you can bring to this position?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Applied through portal. The manager emailed me to set up a video call. Video call lasted 20 mins. He asked about my resume. It was short and easy, the managers were nice.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self.

title: Tutor/Grader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: I applied through on-campus employment, this position only opens for graduate students. I interviewed with a professor who posted this position and she asked about the courses I took before.
Interview Questions: The courses I took in school

title: Graduate Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was based on Java and SQL, in which I was asked questions on Inheritances and its types, CLasses, Objects, Void meaning, and in SQL I was asked to write a simple update query for a given table with joins.
Interview Questions: Explain what is Multilevel Inheritance?

title: Municipal Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Clear, although hard to find the application. At least they gave me a phone interview despite the pandemic. Person was clear about desire to give me a chance to work.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience do you have?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: The supervisor set up a call with me and when I joined the call, there was another senior person on the call.   The supervisor was very appropriate but the second person was very antagonistic about a leave of absence and didn't care about my background and skillset.
Interview Questions: Will you be able to teach online if necessary?

title: ITSM Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Short listing first interview.

Then met with a panel of all involved members.  They took the time to answer all my questions also.

They were friendly and didn't make me feel like it was a test
Interview Questions:
What do/did you do relevant to this job?

Why did you apply?

How would you address procedure xxx?

title: Tech Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a call with the manager asking for timings, skill set. They go based off your resume, so as long as you know basics of tech you will do great!
Interview Questions: 1. What’s your graduation year? 2. Have you done this role before? 3. How familiar are you with this equipment? 4. How many hours can you work?

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was scheduled. It was considered a screening. The interview became more challenging. During the second round, they asked about experiences and perspectives. I they seem to value, openness, and honesty, and the use of examples.
Interview Questions: Experience with diversity helped tremendousky

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Start by submitting your resume and attending an information session. Move onto a group interview where other RAs observe your behavior. Do not obsess over the literal answer to questions, like most group interviews they are gauging how you participate in a group setting. If you move on, a 1:3 interview will be conducted. You know about your application status by spring break.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had a conflict with a supervisor and what was the end result.

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was very good. There was a panel of 4-5 prof. They started with the projects and then scenario based questions and experience and all. Everything was great and looked easy.
Interview Questions: what is the most difficult challenge you've faced during your project?

title: Doctoral Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: first send a resume and get schedule a face to face meet with the professor. If cant meet F2F,  schedule skype call.  Directly approach the professor you wish to work with, either talking to him or contacting via someone in the research group.
Interview Questions: How previous work is related to work done by professor, what instruments worked on before,  previous publications, whether capable of handling stress, what is future research goal, whether go into teaching line or industry

title: Campus Center Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed interview process. Just wanted to see if I can keep a conversation with the manager.  Almost everyone gets the job. Pay isnt bad but hours are very flexible
Interview Questions: What kitchen utensil are you?

title: Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview went. we discuss about projects I want to work on. the interviewer asked background in my major, and previous internship experience, and also skill sets I had.
Interview Questions: background in wireless communication, and basic engineering stuff

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
IT was pretty good, amazing experience 
interview wasnt hard either , they asked basic questions 
for example: tell me about yourself etc, just be confident and dont get nervous, it would be good
Interview Questions:
tell me about yourself 
and some other basic questions

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and straight to the point. I was interviewed via the Office Manager who asked mostly behavioral questions and my previous interactions with customer service. The questions were straight to the point and I was given a good time to think about it and answer it as anyways I wanted. One of the best interviews I had done and I was very comfortable the entire time, and did not feel rushed at all.
Interview Questions: Describe your strengths and weaknesses

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: You must take the course in previous semester and score A or in undergrad, you must have to score either A+ or A. However everything depends on the Professor because He will make the decision in the end. Almost 80% graduate courses have 1 or more TA. So, apply through Employee portal and always visit professor's office.
Interview Questions: Computer Algorithms and Data structures

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was simply related to the resume. The professor looks to give students an opportunity who would like to work with dedication and bring results on the table at the end of the work period. This is what every professor expects from a student.
Interview Questions: why do you want to do research?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer asked me questions that were in my areas of interest and made me feel comfortable so that I can perform the interview properly. It was a good experience in the end.
Interview Questions: what is my GPA?

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: For those interested in applying, applications open up online. You must answer the questionnaire and attach a resume. Candidates are chosen to be brought in for an interview. After all interviews are completed, emails are sent to everyone regarding if they received the job or not.
Interview Questions: How would you work with your co-mentor if you noticed they were starting to slack?

title: Phonathon Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Apply online and you receive a phone screening. Have an excited tone of voice that shows you are inviting to have a discussion with. The screener will ask you questions about how you would handle situations and you need to answer in a way that shows you are friendly and good to converse with.
Interview Questions: how would you handle a certain situation with a caller to secure funds?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was about a brief introduction about myself and the project which I have done, and later spoken about the future scope of the research process and was asked ideas from my side to test my creativity.
Interview Questions: Asked to explain my projects

title: Enrollment Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: During the interview process they painted a wonderful institution. It went very well. I was offered the job at the end of my interview. If I would have known what I know now I would have never taken the position.
Interview Questions: Name a difficult situation you had to encounter and how did you resolve it?

title: Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and straightforward. Initial screening then interview an interview with one senior member or student manager of the department  They  respond to you within a week to let you know whether or not you got the position
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had to confront someone because they broke a rule/law or protocol.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Invited to attend face to face direct interview with the supervisor within 1 week of application.  Interview was fun and mostly about the ideas and interest towards the role.
Interview Questions: General questions about past work experience

title: Gameroom Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Short, easy, straight forward. Like a typical retail job interview. How did you hear about this position?
What do you know about our company?
What do you hope to gain from this position?
Where do you see yourself in five years?
Interview Questions: Typical retail questions, availability, and teamwork capabilities

title: Delivery Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was mostly straightforward. It mostly pertained to your technical abilities when it comes to audio-visual equipment and how to troubleshoot for  common problems. If you are any familiar with internet connectivity, projectors , desktop and how they relate to each other , you should be having no issues.
Interview Questions: What would you do if your projector is projecting fine while there is no audio coming from the speakers?

title: Field Data Collector Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: None. There was only resume screening and I got the job based solely on it. Make sure you gear it more towards non-technical achievements you have had in the past and include your GPA on it. The more the GPA the higher your chances of getting in. I got an email from the HR department of the University saying I was hired and that was mostly it.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was looking to be a part of a dynamic lab, then my advisor referred me to the Center for Injury Biomechanics materials and medicine lab. I received an email from the lab scheduling interview dates.
Interview Questions: They asked my past experience of working in a lab.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a three round process that started with a form and then we were called for interview which took place in the month of February 2017 and was conducted on campus and took almost a month to complete
Interview Questions: What was a challenge you faced that you were able to tackle without any assistance from your friends or peers?

title: Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: First you have to apply online and wait quite some time. It took 2 months to hear a response. Set up an interview within a week. The interview was short, 10 minute. Hire on spot.
Interview Questions: How do you get into the bios on a dell PC

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Asked about the typical applications of software development. A face to face interview with the faculty along with past experience. Then I got the offer after some time over the phone.
Interview Questions: Technologies

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: a small project is assigned to you to finish. Not so hard. The prof is very nice and gives a  lot of suggestions. I might work with him in the future for the Ph.D. program.
Interview Questions: C++ questions

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: As a former FT employee, my interview was atypical, but having participated before in interviews from the other side, I know that if someone has taught that course or a similar one at another institution, the path is generally quite easy.
Interview Questions: Have you taught this course before elsewhere?

title: Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Attend information sessions and submit your non-technical resume which represent customer satisfaction. After that, if selected have to go through telephonic interview followed by face to face interview. Last but not the least, have to complete in-person training and online training before taking shifts.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with NJIT Reslife?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was of 2 rounds. First was about knowing experience and knowledge.
Second was more like a technical interview. where they asked me more about networking and cloud computing. Also professor reference is required as this research assistant job.
Interview Questions: About previous experience and knowledge.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very professional. They had asked for my resume, then an online screening and finally an interview in person. The process was very much good and I was kept well informed through out the process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: First you will need to attend to one of the information sessions from the reslife department where you will have to give your ID and Resume at the end of the session, they will screen out the resumes, and , if selected, they will send you an email with an option to select a time to be interviewed, you will have the choice to apply for 2 positions on the reslife department, if selected, they will send an email stating so. Then they will give you instruction in order to get an SSN and other paperwork.
Interview Questions: What previous experiences do you will will help you in this position.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Worked as a teaching assistant; was offered the position afterwards with a simple phone interview. Interview process was a review of my experience teaching and a discussion of the work I was currently doing. Was accepted within a week.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience as a teaching assistant and explain how you handled a difficult situation with a student.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Set up through a recruiter. Got phone call after two weeks and got invited for in person interview. Very nice people and questions were not very difficult. Did a laboratory tour, met faculty and staff. Current projects were describe and I gave a presentation on my past experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was short. 15 mins tops. I came in and the Interviewer who was a resident coordinator told me to take a sit. He was very nice. Asked only behavioral  interview questions
Interview Questions: Behavioural questions like how did you handle a conflict situation

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was casual. If we have a good GPA then it is easy to get the position and we have to apply frequently. so that they can come across our resume. They will ask general HR questions. Our background, the way we speak and etc.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Delivery Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Vic was being really easy and had two of his most senior guys interview me. Already was tensed but that certainly led to everything going good. Overall an easy interview. And in all the while that I am employed there I must admit one thing - 

Proud to be associated with ITMS!
Interview Questions: Smart carts and other technical questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: There is not any specific interview, you just apply through university website and then they evaluate your resume. The deadline is around Jan 15. And you should be careful to submit all the required documents.
Interview Questions: Your publication plays an important role for PhD program

title: TA/RA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied for PhD and a professor called me. They asked me several question regarding my field and then I have been accepted as an RA at the beginning. Letter I become RA and then an instructor
Interview Questions: how synchronization is done in communication? What is Channel coding? What is Turbo code

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process. They just checked to see that my GPA and grades for the specific classes which I would be tutoring for were an A. And then, I was told to apply online and that I would automatically be offered the position.
Interview Questions: How many hours would you be able to work per week?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: went smoothly. asked questions, i answered. asked me to come back later and when i did asked me more questions. then I did answer. so i said i will  work there and they let me. that has worked out ever since.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Collecting and mailing by the dealing the package with your Transcript and diplomas, toefl with the certain score, gre with the certain score, cover letter, few recommendations, immunization form, English level proof, sevis student record, connections.
Interview Questions: Why your gre results were not so stellar?

title: Archivist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied through CDS LINK. I was directly hired and did not have an interview. The job was given to me through the Federal Work Study Program for students. I was a Theater Major, so i needed experience working in my field of study. I never had to interview with the theater department because i was a scholarship recipient and i had work study funds given to me through the financial aid department.
Interview Questions: Do you want the job?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Quick interview not much action.  Be sure to dress fomally and be very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very punctual to your interview or they will just call the next person to be interviewed
Interview Questions: How would you handle an emergency with students?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview. I was scheduled to meet with the professor and other two senior phd students in the group. It was a very friendly and causal interview process. They introduced their lab and the Newark area first, and then it was my turn to introduce my research. Finally, we warped it up by letting me ask them a few questions.
Interview Questions: What is your previous research

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions:
Tell me about yourself?
What was your role in previous company?
What is linkedlist?
How will you remove an element?
Interview Questions: Write a code to remove duplicates?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line
Interview Questions: Nothing was really unexpected

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Sept 2012

title: Teaching Assistant- Pre College Program Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a professor working there and my interview was very smooth and friendly. Just the routine questions about my education, work experience and future plans. Also, they wanted to make sure that I would be available for ALL the training sessions.
Interview Questions: They asked if I was comfortable with going on field trips, since some programs included a 2 or 3-day trip.

title: How Do You Like NJIT Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: very quick
Interview Questions: how do you describe yourself for this position?

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark, NJ) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call from a recruiter and talked with him for around half a hour about my background and made an appointment with the hiring manager of that company. Talked with the hiring manager via the phone for more than a hour and went to the company for twice.
Interview Questions: N/A
